title.value: Рост и плодоношение яблони сортов Айдаред, Шампион, Джонаголд на юго-западе Беларуси
Growth and fruiting of 'Aidared', 'Shampion' and 'Dzhonagold' apple cultivars in the south-west of Belarus

subject.value: etapas de desarrollo de la planta

person.name: Kapichnikova, N.G., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing

abstract.value: The investigations were held during 2010-2011 in the orchard of agricultural production cooperative 'Ostromechevo' of Brest region of the Republic of Belarus. The farmstead is located in the western subzone of the southern fruiting zone. The apple (Malus) cultivars 'Aidared', 'Shampion' and 'Dzhonagold' on the clonal rootstock M26 were planted in 2006. The planting scheme was 4 x 1,5 m. The influence of training altitude of slender spindle (2,0 m, 2,5 and 3,0 m after tree pruning) on apple tree growth and fruiting was studied. It wasn't revealed the real influence of altitude training variants on trees growth vigour. Only cultivar difference was marked. Trees of 'Dzhonagold' cultivar were growing more intensively and cross sectional stern area was on the average larger by 4,2 square cm than at 'Aidared' cultivar and by 3,8 square cm larger than at 'Shampion' cultivar. Larger yield of 8,8 tons per hectare was gotten at 'Aidared' cultivar on the fifth year after planting just as 51,1 tons per hectare on the average was gotten at 'Dzhonagold' cultivar on the six year after planting.
